content.title: Understanding Foundation Types and Importance of Foundation
content.author: Tomcy Engineers and Builders

content.heading: Importance of Foundations in Construction
body: A foundation is the lowest part of a building structure that transfers the load of the building safely to the ground.
Foundations play a vital role in ensuring stability, durability, and safety of any structure.
points: Load Distribution: Spreads the building load to the ground evenly.
Stability: Anchors the structure against forces like wind and earthquakes.
Prevent Settlement: Avoids uneven sinking and cracking.
Water Resistance: Protects the building from groundwater.
Durability: Ensures the structure lasts long without failure.

content.heading: Types of Foundations
body: Foundations are broadly classified into two types: Shallow Foundations and Deep Foundations.

content.heading: Shallow Foundations
body: These are used when the soil near the surface has good bearing capacity and the load is relatively light.

types.name: Isolated Footing
types.description: Supports a single column. Used in small buildings.

types.name: Combined Footing
types.description: Supports two or more columns where space is limited.

types.name: Strip Footing
types.description: A continuous strip that supports load-bearing walls.

types.name: Raft Foundation
types.description: A thick slab that supports the entire building. Used in poor soil.

content.heading: Deep Foundations
body: Used when the top soil is weak and loads need to be transferred to deeper levels.

types.name: Pile Foundation
types.description: Long columns driven into the ground to reach hard strata.

types.name: Pier Foundation
types.description: Large cylindrical supports placed deep into the soil.

types.name: Caisson Foundation
types.description: Watertight retaining structures used in bridge or underwater construction.

title: 2. Vastu for Residential Planning
content: Vastu Shastra guides room placement for harmony. Kitchen in SE, master bedroom SW, and entrance in NE are common practices.

title: 3. RCC Column, Beam and Slab Basics
content: Reinforced Concrete Cement (RCC) forms the skeleton of modern buildings. Proper lapping, cover, and bar bending are key for safety.

title: 4. Importance of Waterproofing
content: Leakages weaken structures. Common waterproofing includes brush coat, membrane, and chemical-based methods like Dr. Fixit.

title: 5. Brick vs Concrete Blocks
content: Bricks offer thermal insulation; blocks offer cost & speed. AAC blocks are light and popular in modern homes.

title: 6. Electrical Planning in Homes
content: Plan switchboards early. Use MCBs and ELCBs for safety. Mark TV, AC, and kitchen points before plastering.

title: 7. Types of Flooring Materials
content: Popular options include vitrified tiles, granite, marble, and wooden flooring. Vitrified tiles are cost-effective and durable.

title: 8. Plastering & Finishing Tips
content: Apply 2 layersâ€”rough and smooth. Always cure for 7 days. Add chicken mesh at brick-RCC joints to prevent cracks.

title: 9. Site Safety Measures
content: Safety helmets, gloves, and netting are essential. Keep first-aid and signage on site. Supervision reduces accidents.

title: 10. Rainwater Harvesting Basics
content: Capture roof runoff using pipes and store in a sump. Add filters before storage. Helps recharge borewells and save water.
